action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a pantry now. There are a freezer and a refrigerator. The freezer is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a apple, a peach, a banana, a sandwich and a orange.
You take the sandwich. In your inventory you have a sandwich.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room and a pantry here.
The cupboard is now open. The cupboard is empty.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate and a sandwich.

You are in a pantry now. There are a freezer, a apple, a refrigerator, a orange, a peach and a banana. The freezer is closed. The apple is in the refrigerator. The refrigerator is open. The orange is in the refrigerator. The peach is in the refrigerator. The banana is in the refrigerator. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
You can't see a pillow here.
You can't see a book here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
You can't see a counter here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a living room and a pantry here.
The plate is already in your inventory.
You can't see a table here.
